intro: Schradera membranacea subsp. membranacea, commonly known as the membranaceous schradera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a membranous texture, giving it its common name. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
